description: Great spring rolls and they came out super quick. Pretty small shop so you can't really sit more than a few people in there, but it's awesome for grabbing lunch and taking it to go.
author: Madeline M.

description:
My son and I were in the neighborhood so we decided to give this place a try. 
Very tiny walk-in place hidden on a narrow side street. I can see this place having a major parking problem. We were there close to closing time so no problem parking at that time. 
Since we're not in SF that often we decided to get a few different items to try and save for the next day. 
Here's what we ordered;
Pork/shrimp spring rolls with the peanut sauce. Neither of us really cared for these. I'm used to Dharmas (capitola, ca) spring rolls and so far no one can beat their product. 
Shaking beef bahn mi - excellent 
Meatball bahn mi - extremely delicious 
Pork special bahn mi - good but probably wouldn't order this again. I didn't care for the meat texture:/
Overall, we liked it and will return next time we're in the area.
author: Kim H.

description:
Really good quality sandwiches here.  First, the bread here is high quality and toasted well.  I hate it when the bread is too hard and crusty and they rip the roof of your mouth like Cap'n Crunch.  

I think this place is unique, not only in its offerings, but the amount of meat is pretty generous.  I did wince at the price of said sandwich (as I'm used to paying $3.50 for s good banh mi in Seattle) but I'm happy with it.
author: Jason L.

description:
I usually try to let my meals digest (literally!) before I write a review, but I really have nothing else to do while I wait for my duty as a citizen to resume here at Hall of Justice.

Walking up, this is another small operation Dinosaurs...seems like that's their theme despite the size of the creatures in their name. However, size is no judgment factor for Dinosaurs because the sandwiches and spring rolls are all churned out efficiently, are generous in portion, and look rather appetizing. And trust me when I say that this place felt like a literal godsend to me. I don't exactly have positive experiences in this area (woo car break-in!) so I definitely didn't want to wander far. So finding this place just half a block away? Hallelujah!

But let's talk sandwich. The baguette is toasted perfectly - golden brown with a symphony of crackles. I opted for the special, of course, and found it very filling with its pate, fancy pork, special ham, and all the goods (cilantro, pickled carrots/radish, jalapenos, cucumbers). It hit all the notes of savory, creamy, crunchy, and slightly spicy. Really good. 

I do wish there were some tables to sit at though. I was relegated to eating on the steps of the Hall of Justice....not even going to wonder how grimy that was.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I came in at 4:15pm waited 16 minutes to be helped. No one at the register or in line. I'm a very patient person. They should just close at 4pm if they will not help anybody! Left without ordering.
author: Ian V.

description:
Ordered chicken sandwich and chicken and shrimp bring rolls with peanut sauce. All chicken is dark meat just fyi. 

Delicious and quick. Homemade bread. 

My only complaint was plastic packaging and the fake grass made of plastic that was used to separate my spring rolls. Why???!!! Especially in a progressive city like SF where we refuse single use plastic and promote compostable products.
author: Christine V.

description:
Excellent location and delicious sandwiches.
I got my order pretty fast, great customer service. The quality of meat was good as well. Especially the veggie to bread ratio.
author: Anisa A.

description: Great sandwiches, but a little overpriced and if you go around lunch time when the court house is on break, you can expect to wait for about 30 minutes for your sandwich in the tiny little shop.
author: Neil D.

description:
I've been a fan of Dinosaurs since the first time I discovered them in the Castro. Sure, they're the millennials' banh mi and definitely not the same as the Vietnamese hole-in-the-wall in the Tenderloin or Eastside San Jose, but considering most of these areas of SF are lacking in Vietnamese cuisine, Dinosaurs hits the spot. 

This is the third location I have been to and I'm just thankful it is walkable from my office. That being said, I don't know what changed recently but everybody and their moms come here now so weekday lunch rush is a pain. Call ahead so you can pick up and call way ahead because we have called ahead before and still waited a bit when we got there. 

Nevertheless, I'm always a fan of Dinosaurs!!
author: Peggy C.

description:
Located on a side street across from 850 Bryant St. (Hall of Justice).

I was on jury duty back in Dec 2016 when a fellow juror took out a banh mi sandwich.  She said she got it from Dinosaurs nearby.  I didn't have a chance to get one while we were on jury duty until just yesterday when I was at the HOJ to protest a traffic violation.

The menu board is a duplicate of the other Dinosaurs sandwich shops.  This location is strictly a take away place.  No sit down tables at all.  For some reason they've got a pinball machine inside the tiny sandwich shop.

I got the beef kare kare banh mi which was a special.  As it was around 11:15 am, there was no wait.  My sandwich was made to order within minutes.  Got it home and it was still fairly warm.  

Including tax, it was $8.95. 

Check in on Yelp for 10% discount if you are so incline.
author: Shirley N.

description: My first meal since moving to SF - how delicious! This hole in the wall spot is a great lunch spot with plenty of vegetarian options. No seating so great if you're looking for a quick take out options.
author: Ayumi W.

description:
Dinosaurs was a pretty nice option to have as my jury duty lunch break.  It's right across the court room, so I had plenty of time to sit in the sun and eat my sandwich and not think about all the overly invasive questions they ask you in that jury box.

That being said, I've had better banh mi in other places.  The combination banh mi was all right.  There was something off in the balance of flavors.  The bread wasn't light enough for my taste, and made the sandwich seem overly heavy and hard to finish.  I was not a huge fan of the pate, it seemed kind of watery?  Price was also pretty high for an all around just kind of okay sandwich experience.  I've had stellar banh mi in Sacramento for half the price.

Tips and Tricks
-They give you a pretty long lunch break for jury duty, so maybe walk a little farther and find something yummier
author: Jessica L.

description:
Was craving a Vietnamese sandwich today, and came across this spot on yelp. I usually order the special / combo etc at bahn mi places, so did that here as well.

There was 1 meat (the pork?) which was overly fatty and completely dry at the same time. I pulled most of it out of my sandwich after a few bites, and that made the sandwich a lot better. If not for this meat, maybe I'd bump this place up to 4 stars.

Location is also a bit hidden, making parking very difficult. I saw a parking lot on the way out, but it seems there was only a daily rate, which does not make sense to do just for a grab and go lunch. For most customers having to park illegally and risk being towed while grabbing a sandwich, I wish Dinosaur could make sandwiches slightly faster.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
Pretty decent Bahn Mi! Fresh bread and tasty sauce.

My only issue...the pork in my sandwich had a green-shine to it, which is generally from Pseudomonas growing on the cold cut meat. Minus one star for less-than-fresh ingredients :(
author: Mith R.

description: Good quick pickup and go bun mee place! I stick to he crispy tofu which is shreds rather than full tofu pieces. Tip - order in advance and pick up rather than waiting in line to order and waiting for the food to be ready
author: Ruchi M.

description: Don't waste your time calling ahead. I called in an order and when I went to pick it up they didn't prepare it ahead of time. If you don't allow for pick ups, let us know when we call. Probably not going back to this location.
author: Christine N.

description: I got extremely sick here, I think it was salmonella. I had four days of fever and it's been two months and still my body isn't normal and I've had to go to the doctor several times.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Delicious Vietnamese sandwiches with a few unique spins, including a steak sandwich and a spicy tuna version.  They also have Vietnamese Coffee and a couple smoothies (mango+mint and watermelon+lychee). 

There's no seating here, so plan to take your food to go.

On par with Saigon Sandwich in the Tenderloin, but twice the price.  Minus one star for that.  But on the bright side, they do take credit cards.

Definitely worth swinging by if you're next door, but probably not worth a trip.
author: Greg B.

description: I love Dinosaurs! This is the third location I've tried and its just as good as the others! Nothing like a nice bahn mi to cut my work day cravings. The Special, Grilled Pork and Shaking Beef are all delicious. I just wish there was a seating area to eat the sandwiches!
author: Jenny E.

description: Amazing food at affordable prices. I tried the grilled chicken sandwich and the mango and mint smoothie. Both amazing!
author: Dhruv V.

description:
A great way to make your jury duty experience a better is to swing by Dinosaurs across the street. They should seriously offer a discount for jurors! Ha!

The sandwich was sooo damn good that after jury duty, I bought another one to go... I'm such a sucker for Vietnamese sandwiches. I thought of it as a reward for enduring the process.

Anyway, the sandwich is almost perfect -- just a little too much carrots for my liking. However, it's still one of my favorite places for a Vietnamese sandwich. It IS pricier than average. Also, keep in mind this place has no seating but eh, you can people watch when you eat outside the Hall of Justice. Don't forget to check in for a small discount!
author: Janet H.

description:
Ban mi is supposed to be cheap. That's one of the most important parts of ban mi. Cheap and there's carrots in the sandwich. Dinosaur isn't cheap (yes carrots). 

There are so few options by the courthouse. So few. Dinosaur is an option. All of the food is human food that you can eat.
author: Colin J.

description:
After getting Dinosaurs for the third time this week, I thought it might be time for a review. 

I've only ever had 2 items from the menu. The special and the pork and shrimp rolls. Yes, the price is high for a banh mi but this is San Francisco. What do you expect? It's still less than $10! 

The pork and shrimp rolls with peanut sauce are SO BOMB. All the ingredients are so fresh and I love that they add apple in the mix to add the perfect level of sourness. 

My only complaint is that they close by 5 pm on weekdays and are closed on weekends. Honestly, that's probably better for my wallet though. :P
author: Gina P.

description: Good food. Pricey for the location and quality, but it's ok.
author: Ichor B.

description: It's okay. A bit dry, marinade was mediocre. The price is good but would rather pay more for a better sandwich. Reviews says it's great for vegetarians. As a veg., must say that Dragon Eats is waay better.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Dinosaurs sandwich was SUPER BOMB!

I got the special with a vietnamese coffee for a total of $12!

The bread was warmed and incredibly crunchy. They loaded the pâté and the meat! The vegetables were crunchy and fresh. I'm not much of a spicy person so it was nice that there were 1 or 2 jalepenos that gave this sandwich the perfect kick. The sandwich was so big that I had to split it in 3!

We came around 12pm on a Wednesday but the line wasn't too bad. They have super fast service and friendly staff. If you decide to order online, make sure to order around 30+ minutes beforehand!
author: Linda K.

description: Love love love this little banh mi shop. Super convenient location in SOMA for those who work in the area. Great quality sandwiches. Not a lot of variety but they're all great. Rather expensive compared to other Vietnamese restaurants but still delicious!
author: Lushi Z.

description: I give it a 3 stars because of the price.  The taste is good but half a block away at Turtle Tower, their sandwiches are $5.75.  About $3 cheaper, larger and similar in ingredients.  Taste buds say both taste similar.  I remember when Dinosaurs opened up a couple of years ago, their prices were about $6.
author: The Batman Of S.F. V.

description:
Everything here is just so high quality, I can't even complain that the price is up compared to dirt-cheap vietnamese sandwich places. 

My absolute favorite is their vegan fried tofu sandwich. They somehow managed to replicate shredded pork w/ noodles in a way that is even tastier than the original. I discovered them through MealPal, but I come back to pay full price for that sandwich.
author: Christine K.

description:
yay


now i don't have to drive into the city for a perfect bahn mi


the bread is outta this world and baked on the spot

perfect $8 sandwich is heaven!

incredible ingredients

ice cold iced coffee with condensed milk - yum and to cool down the jalapeno burning my tongue!
author: Charlie B.

description: Came here while i was on jury duty. It was busy since i came during prime time lunch hour. I waited about 5 minutes for my food. I got the special sandwich for $7.49 and water bottle for $2. Quite expensive even though i used the 10% off through yelp when you check in. I guess they may cater toward non asian or base on location since its close by the police station and hall of justice. Anyways, the sandwich was average. They put decent amount of the pork patty. They really stuff a lot of shredded carrot. They put a lot of the pate. I thought the bread was more on the tough side. But It does satisfy my craving for Vietnamese sandwich.
author: Julie N.

description: Dinosaurs is our whole team's go-to place for lunch. They make delicious sandwiches and spring rolls fresh daily - and most of the time just a few minutes before you enjoy them. They also have a selection of soft drinks. These are pretty pricy but as they explain they have unique flavors that ship from Texas and Carolina. My go-to is the pork & shrimp spring rolls with peanut sauce. Nom!!!
author: Noémie G.

description: A little expensive for vietnamese sandwiches but the quality is amazing. The sandwiches are filled and the flavor is great.
author: Nelson H.

description:
Dinosaurs is literally located right behind my office so I have often seen my co-workers munching down on Bahn Mi sandwiches and little spring rolls when they are in a crunch for time.  Finally, I decided to give this little spot a try today during lunch and was super surprised by how great it was! 

Dinosaurs is located in a little ally across from the Hall of Justice, so a great option if you're on jury duty or (eeek) for some reason over at the county jail.  Walking in, this place is VERY small.  No seating, but for some reason they have a giant pin ball machine taking up a great deal of space, boxes of chips stacked in the corner and enough room for maybe 5 people to stand while waiting on their food.  The menu is fairly simple, a selection of Banh Mi including tofu, mushrooms, chicken, beef, pork, tuna and spring rolls with tofu, shrimp, and pork.  There are fountain sodas as well as interesting smoothies such as avocado and some kettle chips for a side.  

I went for the Tofu and Taro spring rolls with choice of dipping sauce (hoisin).  WIth the 10% off your order from yelp check in they were under $7, which is a great price for the fairly large portion of 3 rolls per order.  The wait time was under 5 minutes for my food, so a great option if you're in a rush at work.  

The spring rolls were fresh and flavorful.  They were full of tofu, rice noodles, lettuce, cilantro, and mint.  I didn't love the shredded tofu strips - a bit of a weird consistency, but overall good flavors.  Also, I was given the peanut sauce instead of my requested hoisin... I did like the peanut sauce but this isn't what I requested and I could see this being an issue if someone has an allergy.  Overall a nice and filling option for lunch in the area (where it is fairly limited), I will be putting this into my lunch rotation at work for sure.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
I tried the chicken bahn mi sandwich with fried tofu added. 

The chicken was pretty tasty but the shredded fried tofu didn't do anything for me.

Friendly and fast service--I'd check it out again and try some other proteins next time
author: Mimi T.

description: The bhan mi are amazing and really if all they served was the watermelon lychee frozen drink I would be a loyal customer. The boardman location is tiny so be prepared to wait in a line if you come during the lunch hour. Overall a releat place for me and my coworkers!
author: chantelle v.

description:
Good food, especially for the price. Generally quite fast service, too. Interesting selection of drinks, too.

but ffs they could clean up their shop a little bit, and maybe have a little space for a few tables ... they do have ceiling-high stacks of boxes & a pinball machine in there, leaving barely enough room to awkwardly weave and bend around people to exfiltrate one's self from the line after order, and then back in again to get your sandwich ...
author: Andrew P.

description: This place rocks as does their other location out on Ocean. Truly yummy and great sized portions.
author: Eithne C.

description: Probably amazing for meat sandwiches but their Portobello Mushroom was mediocre at best---tasteless sandwich that I had to douse with Sriracha.
author: H B.

description: I really love this place! Excellent food for a super affordable price. Quick service, especially if you go before the noon thirty rush (to go orders only, no seating). They have a few options that aren't just vegetarian but vegan, which I appreciate a lot. I get the tofu bahn mi with extra jalapeños and an avocado shake! The tofu is fried, bread is crunchy and chewy. Avocado shake was a little strange at first but now is one of my favorite drinks ever. Soooo delicious. You can order ahead on MealPal now! One of my favorite places!
author: Vee S.

description: Best bahn mi in SoMa. Toasted bread, ample veggies and pate, quality meats, and a great taste. A tad spendy but what isn't in SoMa?
author: Brian J.

description: Their sandwiches pack a lot of flavor. They're on the pricier side compared to a mom and pop shop, but certainly worth it. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because the amount of veggies it has can vary and is a bit disproportionate (too many carrots or not enough cucumber). Their coffees are excellent! I want to try the mango mint smoothie next
author: Daisy B.

description:
Y'know dat Dinosaurs Faurs.
My stomach was like raurs.
Ate pork special banh maurs.
Watermelon lychee slushaurs.
Take-out only bc no chaurs.
So go home watch Empiaurs.
author: Dan B.

description: Great food. Great vegan options. Love this spot. Hard to find parking. Small spot tends to be packed and hot inside.
author: Meishi M.

description:
When it comes to eating Vietnamese sandwiches I'm generally pretty easy to please.  As long as the bread is good and the components are fresh I'll have very few complaints.  That said I was quite thrilled when I found out through Yelp of course that Dinosaurs had opened their 4th shop less than two blocks away from my work.

I've long been a fan of Dinosaurs and I frequented their original location in the Castro quite a bit from 2010 when they opened until 2012; however, subsequent changes to my work schedule have limited my visits since.  The meatball sandwich had been my favorite of their sandwiches.  I don't know what it is about ground meat formed into balls but no matter the type of cuisine I love meatballs.

Not having been to any Dinosaurs location in over a year I was excited to see a larger menu than I remembered featuring 2 types of salads, 3 types of spring rolls, 8 types of sandwiches and 5 specialty drinks.  

On my first visit I had, of course, the Meatball sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#9iQ1jK28yQla-xm1-CDDrw).  The French baguette they use here was toasted perfectly exhibiting a nice exterior crunch and the softness of fresh bread on the inside.  Piled high with pickled carrot and daikon, slices of crisp jalapenos, fresh cilantro and a crisp cucumber spear with just a smear of mayo and ground pepper the meatballs were every bit as tasty as I remembered with just the right amount of firmness to hold it all together.

One Vietnamese sandwich rarely fills me up, and at most places I go it takes about two sandwiches to do the job.  So far on my many visits to this Dinosaurs I've found that one and a half would be perfect for my midday appetite.

In addition to the Meatball sandwich I've also ordered:

The Special (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#8hobLrGDKjnRZgrgoquC7Q) with three types of pork products piled high.
Shaking Beef (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#x1xOCLNQ7n7SzU0amEaX9w) with its super tasty beef sauteed with chopped onions.
Grilled Chicken (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#49fnAJPwAuTXuSY6iZd6PA) with a lemongrass infused chicken thigh.

The Roasted Portobello (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#vnBkk2FLuCBaPP32c1jJxg) comes with veganaise instead of mayo, but a check of the ingredients found that it was soy based.  That's something I can't have in my diet so the kind folks here have omitted it and given me the regular mayo at my request.  I'm a big fan of mushrooms so it's no surprise that this is probably my second favorite sandwich here.

I've enjoyed the fresh spring rolls also.  The spring rolls come 3 to an order and you can have it with a choice of 3 sauces - peanut, hoisin or lime fish sauce.  My go to sauce is the peanut which has bits of peanut in it, doesn't have an oily residue like some places and has a mild spicyness to it.  The spring rolls are mostly pre-made and chilled, but sometimes when they're out of the pre-made ones they will make fresh ones for you.  I've had both the Pork & Shrimp (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#iNgoIvKWTna9EMbQTACEXA) and the Chicken & Shrimp (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#I6XM9Nsr9_dad3VN_0jt4w) and both are delicious and filling.

The Shrimp Papaya Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2?select=Yr371eBYQJ23h0jnnL1KQw#Yr371eBYQJ23h0jnnL1KQw) combines shrimp, crunchy daikon, carrots and green papaya with grape tomatoes and a little Thai basil.  Crushed peanuts, deep-fried scallions and a lime fish sauce dressing are included separately to add onto your salad.

To date I've tried only one of their specialty drinks.  The Watermelon Litchi Smoothie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-4-san-francisco-2#SxxF4uow0P2EfBwKixkKEQ) is a blend of fresh watermelon, crushed ice and possibly a sweetener served over bits of fragrant lychee jelly.  The frozen concoction freezes the jelly just enough so what is normally a soft jelly comes up slightly firm.  It's a refreshing drink that I've enjoyed on multiple visits.

In an area of the City where good eats is very limited I'm so happy to have Dinosaurs 4 so close by.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I ate here daily during jury duty at the courthouse across the street. The shop is tiny and sometimes busy during the lunch rush, but the line moves quickly and the service is friendly. There's a pinball machine and a few tables inside while you wait. They have an nice selection of drinks, including Vietnamese coffee and bottled teas. I liked the pork sandwich best, but all were fine. Prices are ok for SF.
author: Nick M.

description: I'm not much of a bahn mi fan but Dinosaurs has the best I've ever tried. The Special was absolutely delicious. and the chicken and shrimp spring rolls were awesome. I especially loved the peanut sauce that came with the spring rolls. It tasted like kare-kare sauce. YUM!
author: Leanne V.

description:
DINOSAURS! They always make really good shrimp spring rolls. I love the idea of having green apple in it. It's so refreshing! Probably one of my favorite Vietnamese sandwich shops in the Bay Area. 

I always have to stop by here every time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Ritney N.

description: my favorite lunch spot! I work a short 5min walk away from dinosaurs and I would eat here every day if I could. My first thought was that the price was a bit high but for the quality of all the ingredients makes it truly worth it. and splurge on a watermelon lychee smoothie, you won't regret it!!
author: Jessica S.

description: Food is good-but-not-great in general, very good based on the lack of good options in the area. The problem is that its just a much less tasty bahn mi then any of the places on Eddy/Larkin and twice the cost. Makes sense to go if you're stuck at 850 for the day but not worth a trip.
author: D Q.

description:
Excellent banh mi in a no frills sandwich shop. 

The grilled chicken (4/5) - incredibly flavorful and the portion was quite filling without anything else. 

The Vietnamese ice coffee (4/5) - strong as expected of this type

Not the best I've ever had but definitely a very satisfying choice and you won't be disappointed.
author: Victor W.

description: First time today, and I'll be back again next weekend. I drove to Pacifica from Hayward because I'm a foodie and anytime I hear about places I should try, I do it. I don't regret driving far for a sandwich though, well for this sandwich because it was bomb!! Only one thing I wasn't pleased with, I had the grilled chicken and there was some fat on the meat that I wish wasn't in the sandwich but it's not going to kill me especially if the flavor was there. I usually am picky with bones and fat, I took a look inside the sandwich before biting it, and took off all of the fat from the chicken. Anyways, let's not make a big deal of something so small because I'll be driving back to Pacifica to have more next weekend. I'm officially hooked. Both my significant other and I enjoyed our first time there today. The food & their drinks were spot on. Their watermelon litchi smoothie was so refreshing and I seen the girl make it, she used fresh watermelon chunks to make it. My significant other ordered a Vietnamese iced coffee and he enjoyed it a lot but after finishing it he also tried the Thai tea which was also very good. We ordered a couple of extra sandwiches for family to go, my significant other ordered another sandwich for himself for dinner too haha.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
This month long jury duty stint has come in pretty handy by both letting me skip work for the majority of the week, and also helping me check off a bunch of my Yelp bookmarks!

Though today was a cold and rainy one, I decided it was time to venture away from my favorite steaming hot bowl of pho from Turtle Tower and try out something completely different. I kid, I kid, I can never get enough Vietnamese food, so I went for a long walk under my green umbrella and finally made up my mind to grab a bahn mi. I was considering Grab 'n Go but felt like splurging a little at Dinos. 

The place is very tiny so you just order to go. The menu, basic but with everything one would need from a Vietnamese sando place. I considered the Grilled Pork bahn mi, but the kindly cashier suggested the Special ($7.39), which is roast pork, fancy pork loaf, lots of pate (yummm), and the usual veggies. I got extra jalapenos which I recommend to anyone who likes four or more slices for your whole sandi.  Loaded up on the Sriracha and napkins, nestled into my new favorite coffee spot, Roma, down the block, and tucked right into my massive meat morsel of magic (like that?). 

While Dinos is on the pricey side for banh mi, I think it's totally worth it. I was full all day from this meal, my tastebuds were satisfied, all was well in the mini world of my lunch hour. Also, if you check in on your Yelp app, you get 10% off, which I didn't notice until after I paid, but I will be using in the coming days.
author: Crystal C.

description: I absolutely love the roasted portabello banh mi here. The flavors are amazing and that bread is so perfectly crunchy. I have a crazy craving for it at times. I will be back to give the tofu banh mi and the vietnamese iced coffee a try.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
In a city with so many banh mi shops, Dinosaurs stands out with its satisfying classics and imaginative fusions.

The sandwiches here will range around $7, nearly double the price of shops in Little Saigon. However, I think the sandwiches here are larger, more consistent, and well executed.

Dinosaurs is really generous with their fillings--when cheaper shops only give a few slices of meat, Dinosaur's banh mis are stuffed. The special, which I usually get, comes with a generous spread of delicious meat pate. Most places usually just give you a thin spread.

Their bread is also perfect--always fresh tasting and perfectly chewy, soft and crunchy. I also appreciate how the sandwich is warmed evenly. A lot of other sandwich places do it very inconsistently.

I have yet to try their spring rolls because I'm still not done trying all of their delicious sandwiches. I think this is the best banh mi shop in SoMa.
author: Yan F.

description: Shaken beef sandwich and mango mint is the way to go. Don't forget to play arcade machine :).
author: Boris S.

description: Like a lot, good sandwiches and spring rolls. There drinks are a must also. Staff is cool and food comes fast...
author: J W.

description:
Want an $8 A+ lunch in this city that's gone off its rocker?

DiNoSaUrS is the way to be. Specifically: PORK AND SHRIMP FRESH ROLLS WITH PEANUT SAUCE. 

I repeat: $7.95 for Pork & Shrimp Fresh Rolls that will make you feel ALIVE. I probably eat these 2x a week and still haven't grown bored of them. 

It's like a salad that's not as healthy as a salad... but you can still rationalize it. The 3 rolls are perfect. They may look 'small' but they are mighty. They will fill you up. 

If you're inclined to branch out and 'try new things' ala social pressures, then you can try a delicious smoothie (mango mint) or a banh mi (all are delicious) I'm just very very partial to the fresh rolls. 

*******All you developer techies who think you need meat in bread form for lunch, trust a stranger on Yelp: try the fresh rolls.******

YOU'RE WELCOME YELPERS!
author: Andrea D.

description: Delicious Vietnamese sandwich. Loved the spicy tuna sandwich! The bread is the bomb and spicy tuna was perfect!
author: June R.

description:
Nice local spot for bahn mi sandwiches.

The bread is very crisp and light, and the fillings were of good quality. Every sandwich comes with pickled carrots and radish, jalapenos, cilantro, and mayo.

I recommend the Special (comes with pate different types of pork) as well as the meatball.  The meatball is a lighter kind made, probably made from chicken or pork, but is seasoned well, quite fragrant, and not too heavy.  

With a $7 price tag, the sandwiches were somewhat small, but still filling.

Other Vietnamese food here is okay.  The iced coffee and spring rolls are pretty standard and far from the best I've had.
author: Brian S.

description: This place is my favorite place to get a bahn mi when I'm in SF by the courthouse. Yes, it's probably overpriced but IT IS DELICIOUS.  Thai iced tea and Thai Coffee are good too.  The shop is hidden on a side street and there really isn't any place to eat inside.  However, just grab a sandwich to go and enjoy the goodness elsewhere!
author: Erica W.

description: This is the best sandwich shop in town. Everything from the shredded beef to the spicy tuna . Yum
author: Karen R.

description: OH MY GAWDDDD this place was amazing. It's a tiny little place with literally seating for one person. I had the Spicy Tuna Sandwich and I couldn't eat it fast enough. I had to force myself to slow down and enjoy the flavors. It's just down the street from the court house so if you're near by, you need to try it!
author: Sal G.

description:
This place is delicious. I have a near by internship and was looking for a quick bite. Well this place is fantastic. The sandwiches are not the cheapest (7.50) but don't dismiss this place because of it. The quality of the sandwich is outstanding. The bread, the meat, everything!!!!! 

This above your typical 4 dollar Vietnamese sandwich. Give them a try!
author: Cece F.

description:
A little pricey when you consider the size of the place, the side street it's located on, and the fact that you can find a quality banh mi for under $5.  That said, the sandwich was stuffed with meats and fresh vegetables, and the bread was both soft and crispy. The real winner here was the avocado shake - wow, a new leader in the clubhouse called SF.  Creamy, strong avocado taste, and even half sweetness was enough.  I'm coming back for this and next time I'll try the spicy tofu or portobello options. 

Pinball machine in house for 25¢?!?!? What!?!?!
author: Ben K.

description: This place is so amazing, it is a hole in the wall and great value. Located in a ally across from the Superior Courthouse on Bryant Street on Boardman st.  I came here when I had to go to jury duty for lunch. The prices are reasonable for big portions. I got the chicken and shrimp spring rolls and a Vietnamese ice coffee. The total was $12 well worth the price, the spring rolls are fresh and big, I was full after I ate the 3 rolls.  The place is take out, so no where to sit there and eat.  Definitely going to go back if I am in the area!
author: Alix J.

description: Lunch times get busy here but I would definitely recommend calling in advance or ordering online. I've tried the chicken & shrimp spring rolls and pork & shrimp spring rolls - both delicious. I'm a huge fan of their peanut sauce as I tend to dunk my spring rolls in it. I also recommend their watermelon lychee jelly smoothie - so refreshing!
author: Karen L.

description:
The manager of Dinosaurs reached out to me and apologized for what occurred the other day. Glad he reached out and offered to fix the issue. Thanks Dinosaurs! 

All I really needed was an apology and not an excuse...
author: Audrey N.

description: Great Thai sandwiches and rolls tucked away in a little alley across from 350 Bryant. Found it while on jury duty.
author: Karen C.

description: Delicious little hole in the wall type restaurant just no where to sit. Food was teriffic
author: Steven C.

description: I didn't get to eat in there but I ordered delivery for a group of 12 people. They arrived slightly late but the service was very good. Everyone was happy with their sandwiches and it even came with a free bottle of Sriracha! The only con is I wish they put more meat into their sandwiches. I recommend the Shaking Beef or their Pork sandwiches!
author: Athena C.

description: I'm not usually a fan of fusion Banh Mi - but Dinosaurs manages to pull it off - especially with the Shaking Beef Banh Mi. Its thinly sliced marinated beef topped with loads of pickled carrots, daikon radish, and cilantro. Finished with just the right amount of mayo and jalapenos and sandwiched between freshly toasted French bread - it has become my go to quick and safe (know its gonna be good) lunch.
author: Henry W.

description: Fantastic, cheap, delicious, quick Bahn Mis from a friendly and polite staff. What more do you want?
author: Brian H.

description: Got my first sandwich from Dinosaurs.  Upon arriving at this tiny hole in the wall sandwich shop near the SF Courthouse with a line out the door - and I realized that I had a PRO TIP that all the hipsters in line did not:  ORDER ONLINE!  My sandwich was already waiting for me when I got there!  Good tofu banh mi - a bit dry and bland -- wish there was more spice to it, will find out if I can get more of the salad/peppers next time.
author: Jenn C.

description: Ordered 20 Sandwiches for the office and everything was on-time and delicious!  Parking is a bit tough around that area, but I am sure it's super popular for those visiting the courthouse.
author: Lance J.

description: Sandwiches are good, service is prompt. I pick some up while at work and then take them home for dinner or weekend meal.
author: Beano M.

description: I had The Special and I will probably get it again. Their prices are higher for some items as of 3/1/15 and while they put something by the menu, they sure don't go out of their way to make you notice. It's literally on a sheet of paper in the corner in size 10 font. Many people who ordered while I was there complained. The sandwich was delicious and much bigger than I anticipated. I have a big appetite so I'm not sure how people are saying they take down two of these plus a spring roll. For $7.39 it's pricey for bahn mi but again thicker than your average Lee's hoagies. They don't skimp on meats and pate, maybe a little heavy on carrots and daikon. I'll be back.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: One of my go to places for a quick lunch bite. All entrees are under $8 so what's not to love? Cons: there is 1 seat inside, and I don't even know if it counts as an actual seat.
author: Tracy L.

description: Shaken Beef Sandwich was good, the veggies were a little over powering and I had an upset stomach afterwards however.
author: Quang N.

description:
Sandwiches are not bad and pretty packed with meat & veggies. Just a little pricier than what I would prefer to pay for banh mi. Not sure if I could bring myself to fork over $9 for a sandwich when I can get 3 for the same price in SJ... All the other snacks are also very pricey too. 

Good option for something on the go. No seating or tables at this establishment so not an ideal place for a sit down lunch.
author: Maryann S.

description:
Killer pinball machine and only 25 cents for five tries!  And sometimes there is a free game just waiting to be played when I walk in there.  Love this place!!

Oh, yeah, the sandwiches are good too, and the guy in charge is always very cheerful.  

There can be a wait during the noon rush since a lot of people phone in orders, so get in by 11:40 or wait until 1:15 to avoid the crunch.
author: Bay G.

description: This is also a great lunch option near 850 Bryant if you've got jury duty!  I had the yummy, grilled chicken bahn mi, plus the popular and refreshing watermelon litchi drink with little bits of litchi jelly - mmm hmm!  The food was so good that I ordered some spring rolls with shrimp, fried tofu and hoisin sauce to go - great combo!  The quality of ingredients was so fresh - loved it!  If you check in on Yelp, use your 10% off dealio because I saw it too late after I spent all my lunch money - the lady at the register wouldn't budge.  I understand but I tried anyway.  They have one table and a little corner seat literally just big enough for one person's butt cheeks to fit (not too comfy).  They have 3 other shops!  I never heard of this place before coming to jury duty so I will need to find the other 3 shops because I got released and won't be back in this area for at least another year hee hee!
author: Maile N.

description: Love love love this place. The service is awesome and the food is great. Not only did they get me hooked on the chicken and shrimp spring rolls with peanut sauce but they also make the best mango mint smoothies. I wish my company wasn't moving two blocks away but I would totally walk over here to grab my favorites for lunch.
author: Evelyn H.

description:
I walked 4 blocks from my office to go to this place, after reading all Yelp reviews. 
So first thing first the place is not cheap. I had their crispy tofu - loved it, very good flavor a and a right mix of spices (actually a bit spicy, as I like it). Also, it was filling for a normal sandwich. Loved the Jalapeños and the tofu shreds.
I also wanted to try their weird Avocado Shake - perfect. It's something that blew my mind. Will surely try it at home.
It will cost you about 12-13 bucks for a sandwich + shake.
author: Ankur G.

description: Quick and convenient shop near SF Hall of Justice. Vietnamese sandwiches are a favorite of mine, and this (grilled chicken with lemon grass) was good, but not great. Cheaper places in Tenderloin are better with more variety, but not as hip as Dinosaurs!
author: Michael H.

description: Hole in the wall kind of place. I had the chicken sandwich. Really good! Definitely recommend this spot.
author: Luis A.

description: No sitting, takeaway only. The sandwich was pretty standard, that means no inspired surprises, but high quality. Overall good value for money, good choice for a quick lunch in the office.
author: Yishai B.

description: When going through the lengthy jury duty voir dire process, you'll need to find a good spot for lunch to get you through the day. Dinosaurs offers a good Vietnamese sandwich at a fair price and is nice and close to the courthouse so that you don't need to walk far to get lunch.
author: Adam S.

description: The Special is really good. A bit pricey but I will try to share with someone next time, those banh mi are too big for me!
author: Coralie S.

description: It was amazing how fast and tasty the food was! I got spring rolls and a mango mint smoothie and I thought it would be bad but it was amazing! I loved the spring rolls and I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Aksh V.

description: Mango mint smoothie too sweet. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: Great sandwiches, great prices, ordered about 10 minutes in advance and it was ready right when I went to pick it up!
author: Erin N.

description:
Yay! Another Dinosaur!

This place is smaller than the others, with no place to sit and only one guy working. Having only one person working means you might have to wait a bit for him to take your order (he's probably making sandwiches) or to make your sandwiches (he's probably taking orders), but they'll definitely be worth it when you get them!

These banh mi hold up to standard and are just super yummy! This year, Dinosaur's prices went up and they instilled a credit card charge minimum (or there's a fee), but that just means an excuse to get more sandwiches that are still reasonably priced!

I highly recommend The Special, with melt in your mouth meats and crunchy, fresh veggies....I think I need to make another trip over!
author: Joshua B.

description:
It's becoming a chain, but I love me some Dinosaurs!!

Lucky for me, I was introduced to this chain at their Dinosaurs Lakeside location (on Ocean Avenue), which is a few blocks from home.  When I came back to work at the Hall of Justice, I found out that they opened this new location across the street from my work.  (How lucky am I to be able to get their delicious banh mis and spring rolls both by home and at work?!?!)

If you're looking for inspiration, my usual order is two of their "The Special" (combination pork) banh mis and one order of their Pork and Shrimp Spring Rolls with peanut sauce and fish sauce.  I usually eat the rolls and one of the banh mis in one sitting (yes, I'm a pig!!) - and because the sandwiches are so good, I save my second banh mi for a couple of hours later, as I'm inevitably going to be craving the taste of their banh mis again and I'll finally have the space in my belly for more food.

Anyway, if you have not yet tried their food, do it.  For real.  You'll be a believer and all of their great ratings will totally make sense...
author: Aileen B.

description: I just bought the shaking beef sandwich during my break from jury duty. It is right across the street from the Hall of justice. The sandwich was delicious. The wait time between ordering and getting it was about a minute.
author: Karen K.

description:
This a tiny, relatively dank chain sandwich shop with pretty much no seating -- let alone a place to stand. Some people have pushover standards of excellence: slap the "bánh mì" label on it, and suddenly it's a five-star restaurant.

Here they don't even go that far, using the "Vietnamese sandwiches" label. Whether it's bánh mì or by any other name, it's hardly ground-breaking, hardly unique: no matter how you slice it, we're talking meat, veggies, and sauce on a bread roll and wrapped in paper. For example, their "legendary" shaking beef. Tell me an Arby's couldn't do this as a monthly special.

The spring rolls are rather pedestrian as spring rolls go, and the Vietnamese coffee and other drinks are typical of most lunch holes in the City. Even the best sandwich shops in the city rarely deserve three stars. This isn't one of those rare ones, and so two stars seems fair for a place that's ultimately forgettable and aspires to be nothing more than a sandwich shop

Nobody who works here ever needed to go to culinary school, and it shows.

With the SF Glamour Slammer across the street, obviously the local standard is prison food. Because nothing else could explain why this mediocre sandwich shop deserves more than two stars for what it serves.
author: Teddy B.

description: The lines can be crazy.  Order on Yelp Eat 24 a half hour in advance.  I like the shaking beef with crispy tofu.  Perfect sandwich size.  Yum!
author: Melanie K.

description:
So happy this place is here! Not only are their sandwiches delicious, the guy at the counter was super nice and patient while helping me decide on what to get. I had the shaking beef and couldn't put it down. 

Although it's super small and take out only, it's very clean and they had a pin ball machine. I will definitely hit this place up a few times a month.
author: Alisha T.

description: The Banh Mi was just average - very dry. I wouldn't go back unless you wanted a cheap meal and had no other options.
author: Rutika M.

description: Friendly staff, and 2 bahn mi options for us vegans in SF! I got the crispy tofu and not only is it good, but it's a great price. There's no seating but there's a pinball machine to play with while you're waiting. I'll definitely be back!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Not bad! Pretty stuffed sandwiches with good flavor and meat. The bread is toasted perfectly for a nice crunch and chew. One sandwich is definitely enough for lunch.

The obvious comparison is between here and Turtle Tower. TT wins out on price (even two sandwiches feels like a better deal). TT offers eggs in sandwiches and uses a lot more butter. Overall, I lean towards TT but Dinosaurs might take the crown back when I try their more exotic sandwiches (tuna fish, vegetarian, or shaking beef.)
author: Alexander J.

description: Love coming here for the spring rolls + avocado and the Vietnamese iced coffee. Great customer service as well!
author: Netty N.

description: As sandwiches go, I was not impressed. Ordered Pork Sandwich, the meat was tough and put on in large slices. It should be shredded and tender. Way too much mayo. Also what exactly makes it "vietnamese"? Carrots and jalapenos? Come on...
author: Joshua G.

description:
So delicious. I love banh mi. However, I would love it if there was a place to eat it on site. Unfortunately, there's no real nice outdoor places to eat around here and since I'm here for jury duty, I have an 1.5 hrs to kill. 

Great location for jury duty though as its only across the street from the hall of justice. 

You can order and pick up as well.
author: Tracy Y.

description: Are you about delicious banh mi and a pretty cool pinball machine that lets you get away with a lot of terrible decisions? Then you should definitely come here. Yeah, it's a little expensive, but it kept me super full so I won't complain.
author: Rosy H.

description:
I guess I'm a bit biased because I love Saigon and Sing Sing so much that this place doesn't do it for me.

It's good if you work in the area and want a Vietnamese sandwich but not something I will ever crave or go out of the way for.
author: Teese N.

description: If you work in the area or are serving Jury Duty at 850 Bryant Street, go over to Dinosaurs Vietnamese Sandwiches at lunch. The Grilled Pork Sandwich is delicious. Nice portion of pork and the veggies are super fresh and crunchy. Don't forget the Jalapeños and Siracha to kick it up a notch. The Pork and Shrimp Spring Rolls are really good too. I added Siracha to the peanut sauce and it was perfect. Pair them both with the unsweetened green tea and you'll have yourself a satisfying and super tasty meal that will hold you over until dinner.
author: Ian H.

description: I was pleased to find Dinosaurs on a recent trip to my office (bonus: super close to work). I tried the lemon grass pork banh mi, which included thick succulent BBQ'd pork and fresh veggies (a tad heavy on the mayo but that's easily fixable). Sure it's a bit pricey for banh mi, but it is SF and the meat and bread are far better than you'd get at a typical place.  The iced coffee was strong and not too heavy on the sweetened condensed milk.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Michelle P.

description: I had better but it wasn't bad. I got the pork and it didn't have any type of flavor just meat and the sandwhich is small to me. Most of the filling in the sandwhich is the pickled that can be overwhelming.
author: Bri A.

description: One of those ideal lunch spots: it's a bit of a hole-in-the wall, fast, and yummy. So far, I've had the pork and the grilled chicken sandwiches, and the mint/mango drink. All of them have the perfect amount of flavor and bread that's not too crunchy. Pinball machine is cool too, although, you may bump in to everyone waiting in line if you decide to play it.
author: chinyere w.

description: Whoops I forgot to take a picture, I was too busy demolishing that sandwich. I got the grilled pork sandwich, which is like a banh mi sandwich. It was the best I've ever had, and I like to think I've become kind of a banh mi expert in the past couple years. All spots have the traditional ingredients, but the difference is the meat and bread. This wasn't the best bread I've had, it was a bit too crunchy,but the pork...oh the pork. Wow. The flavor and crispness was outstanding. Everything worked together magnificently. Too bad I live 2 hours away. Btw, its tucked in a small hole in an alley right across from the police department hall of justice building. What a great spot!
author: Mike S.

description: First time here and not disappointed. Really good banh mi sandwich, good size, not too pricey...$8 and really good thai iced tea!! A good place to lift ur spirits after being in traffic court  OH, and workers are really nice
author: Vilma G.

description: Just finished my sandwich minutes ago. The place is cramped but I go in when there was no line, by the time I left the line was out the door (good timing). I had a special Filipino sandwich and it was delicious. I hope to come back at least every month for lunch, nice new spot!.
author: Stu H.

description: Great quick food, very friendly staff, cute little shop.
author: Ellen T.

description: I usually order The Special with a Thai iced tea through Yelp. It's quick, and the sandwich is fresh and tasty. Its main advantage is that it's seconds away from the Hall of Justice.
author: Amy C.

description: Great little sandwich shop..emphasis on the "little" ...no seating so best to plan on taking your sandwich or spring rolls somewhere to eat them.  Service is fairly fast, and the chicken & shrimp rolls with peanut sauce were good/fresh.  I recommend this place if you have jury duty and don't want to eat at McDonald's for lunch ...since you probably got your egg mcmuffin with coffee there in the morning.  TNT (try new things!)..that coming from someone who is a creature of habit..
author: Kevin G.

description: I work around the corner from this location and I visit at least once a week. The staff is always friendly, fast and the food is good. The prices are just right and the quality is great. I enjoy coming here and checking in regularly.
author: Jax S.

description: The Special is bomb. Best banh mi in SF. Perfect lunch if you're one of the lucky people to be summoned for Jury Duty - located across the street from the Hall of Justice.
author: Dave Y.

description: Meaty sandwiches, which justified the prices.  Good flavor in the roasted pork; excellent combo with plenty of each type of meat. Both heavy on the mayo sauce and light on the veggies so order appropriately. The vietnamese coffee was strong. Off the beaten path, with no seating.
author: Norman H.

description: Super tasty noms. Shaking beef bahn mi is spot on. Their salads are super small in size--although I am used to BunMee's gigantic salads, so maybe not a fair comparison. Takeaway only at this location because they opted for a super annoying pinball game that disrupts the line and pick up area when in use. ***Lose the game, put in some tables.*** I love dinosaurs but they are the masters of the odd location.
author: James S.

description: Amazing! Love it! I come here everyday! The shaking beef and spring rolls rock!!!!!!!!!
author: Paul W.

description: Every day I go to eat my lunch over there and it's the same delicious the place is very clean and the service is very good I definitely recommend that place 18 Boardman
author: Benji J.

description: Sandwich was good size and tasty. Not too salty. Baguette was crunchy.
author: Anna C.

description: Dinosaurs was great. Ordered the roasted pork and pate sandwich; it was loaded with veggies, spicy, and tasty. I will definitely be back!
author: ej l.

description: Amazing!love food fast and friendly the shaking beef. And spring rolls roch! The best dinosaur location yet tank you
author: Alex B.

description: Food is good and portions are huge. The price went up quite a bit. Guess it's to pay their employees the new minimum wage. Because of that, I won't be going there as often as I used to.
author: Loreen L.

description: Very yummy and convenient. Wish they had more outdoor seating for nice days!
author: Andrea A.

description: I tried Dinosaurs twice now. The first time I went it was okay, but I said to myself I would never go back because it was so much more expensive than most other bahn mi places in San Francisco. I understand running a business in San Francisco is expensive and most new businesses can't afford to sell lunch for $4.50, but when I go to a place like Dinosaurs that is a less traditional than its ethnic food origin roots I'd like to be more excited by the menu, give me a reason to choose this place over a cheaper more "authentic" (I hate this description, but for lack of a better work) option. However, about a year later I was interested in giving it another try - I think everywhere deserves at least two chances! I wasn't disappointed with my shaken beef bahn mi, but I won't be back. There are much better bahn mi options for cheaper, including two places within a block (Turtle Tower and the Vietnamese Grab-and-Go). The dressing was too tangy for my taste and there was way too much mayonnaise. The ice coffee is pretty good :) Its worth a try if you're in the area, I'm sure some people will enjoy it more than myself, just not my preference.
author: Asia H.

description: I can't wait to go back!!! Good pork sandwich and tasty spring rolls. Good service. A perfect addition to SoMa. Dsd
author: Darrin D.

description: Overpriced for what you get... $8 for a smallish chicken Banh mi... workers stayed in the back kitchen and didn't come out to take my order despite calling out loud several times.
author: Jim W.

description: Simple, solid, traditional Bahn Mi sandwiches at a reasonable price, considering all these fancy $10-$15 Bahn Mis elsewhere. No regrets here.
author: Logan L.

description: My phone order was quoted at 20 minutes and turns out they made about ten other orders before mine. When asked about the order they lied and told me they were made as orders are collected when in fact they were making orders received way after mine. Lies = bad business.
author: James T.
